docs.lead_paragraph: The proportion of Americans in their mid-teens claiming sexual experience has decreased, and for boys the decline has been especially steep.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by sociology professor Amy T Schalet examines why the proportion of male American teenagers claiming to have had sexual experiences has decreased sharply in the last two decades.
docs.snippet: The proportion of Americans in their mid-teens claiming sexual experience has decreased, and for boys the decline has been especially steep.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new generation is discovering grow-your-own dyes, natural hues derived from flowers, herbs, berries, barks and nuts.

headline.seo: A New Generation Discovers Grow-It-Yourself Dyes

docs.abstract: New generation of gardeners are discovering grow-your-own dyes, which are natural hues derived from flowers, herbs, berries, barks and nuts; tips on how to grow plants that can be transmuted into dyes given.
docs.snippet: A new generation is discovering grow-your-own dyes, natural hues derived from flowers, herbs, berries, barks and nuts.

headline.main: Bringing Dollars and Cents Into This Century

docs.abstract: How should the U.S. update its currency? By going digital? Or replacing "In God We Trust"? Or redesigning bills so the blind can tell them apart?
docs.snippet: How should the U.S. update its currency? By going digital? Or replacing "In God We Trust"? Or redesigning bills so the blind can tell them apart?

docs.lead_paragraph: “October Baby,” inspired by a woman who claims to be an “abortion survivor,” is doing well in movie theaters.

headline.seo: ‘October Baby’ Film Makes a Dent at the Box Office
headline.main: Film Inspired by ‘Abortion Survivor’ Is Quiet Hit

docs.abstract: October Baby, a film inspired by a woman who claims to be an 'abortion survivor,' is doing well in movie theaters thanks to the backing of evangelical groups and churches, but also because abortion is once again causing agitation in political circles; critics say that the film carries an extreme anti-abortion message, a claim that directors Andrew and Jon Erwin deny.
docs.snippet: “October Baby,” inspired by a woman who claims to be an “abortion survivor,” is doing well in movie theaters.

headline.main: The Link Between Income Inequality and Teen Pregnancy

docs.abstract: Teenagers in states with highest income inequality are the most likely to get pregnant.
docs.snippet: Teenagers in states with highest income inequality are the most likely to get pregnant.

docs.abstract: Teenage childbearing is "a symptom, not a cause" of poverty and economic immobility, one researcher says.
docs.snippet: Teenage childbearing is "a symptom, not a cause" of poverty and economic immobility, one researcher says.

docs.lead_paragraph: Senior officials in the Obama administration and the Food and Drug Administration have quietly disagreed over a range of issues.

headline.seo: Areas of Disagreement Between the F.D.A. and the White House

docs.snippet: Senior officials in the Obama administration and the Food and Drug Administration have quietly disagreed over a range of issues.

docs.lead_paragraph: Top officials with the Food and Drug Administration contend the agency’s decisions should be divorced from politics and based solely on its own assessments of the science.

headline.seo: White House and F.D.A. at Odds on Regulatory Issues
headline.main: White House and the F.D.A. Often at Odds
headline.print_headline: White House And the F.D.A. Often at Odds

docs.abstract: Obama administration often disagrees with the Food and Drug Administration on regulatory issues, but FDA officials believe their decisions should be divorced from politics and based solely on their own scientific assessments; Republicans have relentlessly accused Obama of being an overzealous and job-killing regulator, forcing the administration to calibrate its election season positions (Series: Political Science).
docs.snippet: Top officials with the Food and Drug Administration contend the agency’s decisions should be divorced from politics and based solely on its own assessments of the science.

docs.lead_paragraph: Every year millions of children from all walks of life become victims of, or witnesses to, abusive or violent events that can result in long-lasting symptoms of distress. The events can range from sexual and physical abuse to involvement in a natural disaster, fire or serious motor vehicle accident. In many cases, the trauma is unknown to parents and caregivers or never dealt with effectively. The consequences can be devastating for the children and families involved and for society at large. These children are at much greater risk of developing behavioral problems, failing at school, abusing drugs or alcohol and becoming violent themselves.

headline.main: Burst of Therapy Is Boon for Traumatized Children

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column notes that millions of children undergo some form of psychological trauma every year, whether it is abuse, involvement in a natural disaster, fire or serious motor vehicle accident; warns that traumatized children often can go untreated, with lasting psychological and behavioral effects; hails new brief-intervention trauma therapies that can have a lasting positive effect on such children. Drawing (M)
